text-unit.text: Figure 1:An example imageIn the quaint village of Greenwood, nes-tled at the edge of a whispering forest, aunique tradition has been thriving for cen-turies. Every spring, the villagers gather tocelebrate the Festival of Blooms, a vibrantevent marked by an explosion of colors andscents. The festival centers around the com-petition of floral arrangements, where partic-ipants from all age groups display their cre-ativity with flowers handpicked from the sur-rounding woods. The air is filled with the sweet fragrance of wild roses, lilacs,and jasmine, mingling with the sound of laughter and folk music. Children dartbetween stalls, their faces painted with petal motifs, while elders share storiesof festivals past. The highlight of the event is the crowning of the Bloom Queen,a title bestowed upon the creator of the most breathtaking floral display. Thistradition, more than just a celebration, is a testament to the villageâ€™s deepconnection with nature and its cycles
